title: Refuel Your Mind: Circle K for the Soul
text: Although this site only contains classwork now, I hope to further develop it as a landing page for my art portfolio, contains poetry, documentaries, digital art, and motion pictures, along with my more pride-inducing research papers, and perhaps, even a resume.

title: DS Project1 Citations
text: To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: dataset 1
text:
library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(stringr)
cheeses <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2024/2024-06-04/cheeses.csv')

Rows: 1187 Columns: 19


── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (17): cheese, url, milk, country, region, family, type, fat_content, cal...
lgl  (2): vegetarian, vegan

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

cheese_important <- cheeses |> 
  select(cheese, milk, country, color) |>
  filter(!is.na(milk), !str_detect(country, ","), !str_detect(milk, ","))

         
cheese_summary <- cheese_important |> 
  group_by(country, milk) |> 
  summarize(num_cheeses = n(), .groups = "drop") |>
  mutate(num_cheese = as.integer(num_cheeses)) |>
  filter(num_cheese > 1)
cheese_summary 

# A tibble: 52 × 4
   country   milk  num_cheeses num_cheese
   <chr>     <chr>       <int>      <int>
 1 Australia cow            33         33
 2 Australia goat           15         15
 3 Austria   cow            14         14
 4 Belgium   cow             8          8
 5 Brazil    cow             4          4
 6 Canada    cow            43         43
 7 Canada    goat            9          9
 8 Canada    sheep           2          2
 9 Denmark   cow             7          7
10 England   cow            29         29
# ℹ 42 more rows



library(ggplot2)

ggplot(cheese_summary, aes(x = reorder(country, -(num_cheeses)), y = num_cheeses, fill = milk)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  facet_wrap(~milk, scales = "free_y") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Magnitude of Cheese Production Methods by Country",
       x = "Country",
       y = "Amount of Cheese",
       fill = "Cheese Type") +
  theme(
    text = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 8),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 10),
    strip.text = element_text(size = 10, face = "bold"))







ggsave("Cheese Production.jpeg", width = 12, height = 8, dpi = 300)
